title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New York Medical College
Interview Descriptions:
In this particular order: 

(1) a one-hour one-on-one screening call, 
(2) a 1.25-hour panel interview with the team,  
(3) two reference checks, and 
(4) a one-on-one interview with divisional leadership.  All were done virtually except reference checks.
Interview Questions: What makes you passionate about data analysis?

title: Working Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New York Medical College
Interview Descriptions: Process was fluid and all the interviewers were professional. Everything was done in a timely manner and the staff were all pleasant. We came in the morning and it went until around 2-3 in the afternoon.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work there.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New York Medical College
Interview Descriptions: The whole process went smoothly, and we spent most of time on discussing the status of the lab, what we have done and what we will do in the future.
Interview Questions: could you introduce yourself a little bit?

title: SLP Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New York Medical College
Interview Descriptions:
Short; Group interview. About 6 questions asked. 
-why speech pathology 
-what would you do if you got a C
-how do you work in groups 
-how did you hear about speech path.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose speech pathology?

title: Medical Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at New York Medical College (Valhalla, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: They use an MMI setup to see how quickly you can think on your feet and to get a better idea of your actual values. The Interviewers were all very nice and it was more relaxed than I expected. You definitely want to practice answering questions beforehand.
Interview Questions: Do you have any red flags on your application?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New York Medical College
Interview Descriptions:
This was my first interview and I am not a native English speaker so I was quite nervous.  I met with the Dean and 5 faculty members individually  and fortunately,  the interviewers were very kind  and made me feel easy and relaxed.   

It is a small school but the PI-student relationship is one of the best. Location is a plus if you want to focus on research during the weekdays and enjoy NYC on weekends:)
Interview Questions: Tell me about the research you are(have been) doing

title: Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New York Medical College (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Thorough and fair, meet with faculty and residents, received a tour of the facility, they gave a patient case to work up as part of the knowledge assessment and we had to write our work up of the patient
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come here?

title: Desktop Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New York Medical College (Valhalla, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online, received an email from someone in IT who wanted to schedule a phone interview. He called and mostly asked what I do in my current role. Satisfied, he sent me a follow up email asking me to come down to Valhalla for an interview. Showed me around the raised floor, then he and the IT director (?) interviewed in the conference room. Asked how I would mitigate certain problems (eg, malware removal). Most of the interview was the director telling me about the benefits of working there.

The non-director walked me over to HR, making small talk along the way. HR asked me the usual job interview questions and said they would reach out at the end of the week. I emailed them a month later after not hearing from them, they said they'd contact me by the end of the month. Never did, gave up.

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at New York Medical College (Milwaukee, WI) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Process was excellent from HR thru the department.
Interview Questions: Asked about knowledge related to grant writing.

title: Assist Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at New York Medical College (Valhalla, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: straight forward; met with employment manager (human resources), director of advancement and director of alumni relations. position reported to director of advancement; human resources attempted to assess correctness of the match;meeting  director of alumni relations was mostly pro forma and was to confirm decision of director of advancement
Interview Questions:
was there ever a time when....?
how did you handle a particular type of event?
